laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Serum Electrolytes, Glucose, Magnesium, Calcium, Phosphorus, Protein, Albumin, Globulin

laboratory_examinations.findings: CSF: 3090 red cells, 1 white cell, protein 145 mg/dL (high), glucose 62 mg/dL (normal range), lactate 1.9 mmol/L (normal range)

laboratory_examinations.date: Not specified (seventh day after lumbar puncture)
laboratory_examinations.findings: Slow conduction velocities consistent with primary demyelinating sensorimotor polyneuropathy
Abnormal signal in both cerebellar hemispheres and other brain regions, mild volume loss in the thalami, no evidence of acute hemorrhage or infarction
Marked depression of N-acetyl aspartate peak in specific brain areas, indicating severe neuronal loss
